subject: Mental Health
title: Measuring Anxiety
description: A short lesson to help you apply Measuring Anxiety.

hook.text: How do you measure something invisible? Psychologists spent decades figuring out.

buildup.text: The GAD-7 questionnaire scores worry severity with just seven simple questions.

discovery.text: Brain imaging can now reveal anxiety patterns in the amygdala and cortex.

twist.text: Wearable devices are beginning to track anxiety through heart rate variability.

climax.text: Combining self-reports with biomarkers may soon make diagnosis more precise.

punchline.text: Science is learning to see what patients always felt.
